pageContext.claim: “Murders in America’s largest cities dropped by 7 percent between 2016 and 2017.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's caveat of "America's largest cities" is necessary because the overall murder rate has barely changed under Trump, going from 5.4 per 100,000 people in 2016 to 5.3 in 2017, or a decline of 1.4 percent. Like the 2016 rate, the 2017 murder rate was the highest since 2008 — but it’s still better than any year between 1965 and 2009.
